123212221221211112112121111.content:
"Quite the piece of work!" Thiel said, admiring the small robot. The turret would surely make mincemeat of a small horde of zombies. "Of course, I'm happy for any kind of help!" Thiel turned and grabbed a small Colt Anaconda, along with a knife that the previous owner had been kind enough to leave behind. "And about the imposing comment, just give me a chance to prove myself."

No sooner had he said those words, the robot activated. Picking up on the minute whirs and clicks, he smiled and nodded. A bit more firepower would be useful. Walking back to Claire, Thiel sprang back as a spray of fire lanced over Claire's sleeping form, then swept to him. Flipping back over the counter, he flipped the Colt over the top and let a pair of shots out. A sudden silence filled the air as he popped his head back over the counter.

"Um...Cirrus? I'd say you need to work a few bugs out. I really don't want any bullet holes in either myself or Claire, 'k?" he said, laughing and leaping back over the counter. Looking over at Claire, he smiled as he noticed her still sleeping.
123212221221211112112121111.title: Test Run

choices: He gets there and back without a hitch.

1232122212212111121121211111.content:
"Okay, this thing tried to kill Theil? And me?"

"THat's the sum of it, really. But, Theil wanted to prove himself, as he said, so he just figured TRIAL BY FIRE. It's not his fault. Be more specific. I haven't finished hooking up the rest of his AI chips yet." Cirrus wiped his face of grease, the blackish substance coating most of the lower half and his neck. The robot, whose name was Abram, was busy fiddling around with something internally. Theil looked at him oddly as he continued to shudder apprehensively.

"What's wrong with him?"

Cirrus cocked an eyebrow at him. "That? Oh, he's trying to get into walker mode. I installed it as a way of him being extremely mobile, but he's not used to the code yet. Give it a few seconds."

True to his word, Abram began shifting, the massive front half of the tank's tread pods coming loose,and slamming onto the ground with elbow-like joints. A hand folded out from a spot underneath the normal treads, one on each arm. The huge minigun rotated slightly, coming to rest on the shoulder of one, the gun being attached to the forearm. The legs folded out next, the other half of the pods breaking into two sections and folding properly by mechanical hydraulics and pneumatic switches to form two large legs, wide-based for good stability. THe entire middle half rotated, the place where Abram's head was snapped down onto the torso, and part of the lower torso folded down to become the armored skirt. The fully-transformed Abram snapped to attention, giving off a crisp salute.

"See? He's all right. Just needed to accept the programming code. SO, what's first on our agenda?" Cirrus asked, taking a look at a calendar in the corner of the room. The police-themed calendar was scrawled on with all sorts of reminders, warnings, and thing-to-do that Cirrus had put up, to make sure that if he had to stay too long, he stayed on top of things. He ran his finger down to the 12th day.

"All right. Need to go patrol outside, make sure nothing BIG is coming, set up a perimeter with machine guns in here, start making d-turrets for us. And find transportation. Claire probably can't walk too fast with her beauty." Claire giggled at this, and blushed deeply. Theil wrapped his arms around her and planted a small kiss on her cheek, which made her body shake as she giggled again. Cirrus smiled, then felt a stabbing pain as he remembered the task he had yet to accomplish.

"Okay, you two, be good! Don't bring a house party in here!" Cirrus joked as he left, leaving Abram with the two. The couple sat down, Claire's massive rear propping her up about a foot off the ground, her massive cheeks providing a perfect cushion for her and her beau. Abram stood stock still, recording whatever he could, just in case something went wrong. Claire's body elicited a loud rumble as they cuddled, Theil being shaken by the massive action. He looked up and Claire blushed, before turning to Abram.

"Hey, do you know if there's any food here?" Theil asked, before stopping himself. 'It's only a robot, he can't understand me.'

"Yes there is. Back down the hallway to the right is a large storage room, filled with food for the long stay here. Don't eat it all, please. Cirrus requires a lot more calories than you do for what he does. Be careful. MOst of that is still unexplored, so carry a weapon with you. And a few grenades, just in case." Abram lifted a mechanical, black finger toward the gun racks, pointing at a 12-gauge and a small pile of napalm grenades. Theil's mouth dropped to the floor as Abram walked to the door and set up, pulling the minigun to a position he could wield it easily. Theil got up and received the necessary supplies, then began the long trek to the storage room.

123212221221211112221.content:
"Don't eat them, you silly woman! Don't you see what they've already done to your body?" the rather unfriendly old man yelled at her.

"Well, nice to meet you two." she replied, flatly "And I've noticed what they've done to my body, and I rather like it."

She slapped her prodigious bottom for emphasis, and smiled as it jiggled. Thiel sighed contentedly as he looked at it.

"Hmph." sniffed the old man "Do as you like. I guess someone may as well get some pleasure out of my hard work."

"What?" Claire gasped "You...what are you saying?"

"I made these things, these blobs. With the help of my colleagues. They were my path to a Nobel prize, most likely...but now, look at me. Hiding in a bakery. What a world, what a world..."

"You made these? You don't work for Umbrella, do you?..."

"Umbrella? Do the blobs look like zombies? No, Umbrella can hold its monopoly on the hellish undead, I work for a far more philanthropic corporation, by the name of Raincloud. May it rest in peace...our secret labs underneath this city are now as good as gone."

"What are the blobs?"

"Well, young woman, it would probably be hard for a person of your attitude and proportions to understand, but there are those in this world who are starving. Many of them, especially, of course, in the war-torn Third World. These blobs, in theory, could feed those starving masses."

"Okay, so a little blob clearly goes a long way, so you could feed alot of people with relatively little."

"Correct."

"But what the hell's the point of making the blobs mobile and aggressive?"

"Young woman, you are naive. Amount of food, while an issue, is not the true problem. A huge amount of food is already sent to nations in need. The problem is that those in power steal it and hoard it, and use it to insure that no one disobeys them. You'd salute anybody if it's you're only way of getting fed, yes?"

"I guess so..."

"But, by making food with a limited mind of its own, it can specifically hunt out and feed itself to those who truly need it, leaving out the murderous middle man."

"Wow. That actually kinda makes sense."

"I know. That's why I've spent years working on it, silly girl. And we were nearing completion. But...alas, the president of our company, a brilliant and honorable woman, passed away some months back in a car crash. And she left, for reason beyond my understanding, all control of the company to her 19-year-old daughter, Olivia. And Olivia is a charming, clever young girl, but she's also...well...nutty as a fruitcake. And this morning, she asked to taste one of the blobs. We let her, of course, since she is now our boss, but...well, she liked it altogether too much. She went so mad with her desire to eat more and more of them, that she let them all out of their containment pens, where they proceeded to flood into the rest of the labs, and now, into the city above."

"What happened to Olivia?"

"Enjoying her feast immensely, I imagine. Last I saw her, she was already obese enough to make you seem like an anorexic pop star."

Claire was almost ashamed by the fact that she felt jealous.

"So, how many blobs are there?"

"Oh, Lord! Many. Many, many, many. Even I don't know the exact number. But enough to feed whole nations...or, one very crazy, short-sighted girl named Olivia."

"You said your labs are all destroyed?"

"Yes. But...well, before fleeing myself, I copied all data needed to produce more blobs onto this disc..." he brandished it like a sword "If I could get out of this city alive, my Nobel Prize could happen anyway. Oh, and I suppose the lives of all those starving people may be at stake as well."

Claire and Thiel looked at each other, then back at the old man.
123212221221211112221.title: The Story of Olivia and the Blobs

The whole bakery begins to shake and shatter and splinter as if its on a fault line. Claire looks out the window and sees that it's happening everywhere, some buildings collapsing already...crushing many zombies in the process. If Claire wasn't terrified for her own safety and Thiel's, she'd kinda be glad to see that.

Suddenly, Claire, Thiel, the old man, and everything are sent exploding into the air, along with rubble of every description, as all across the city, a soft, gelatinous, flesh-colored substance begins to erupt everywhere, bursting through cracks, rising higher like dough.

"Oh, no!" the old man cries, horrified "IT'S OLIVIA!!!"

Claire's jaw dropped. The whole city was being torn up from below by the sheer enormity of one crazy teenage girl.

Anorexic pop star, nothing. Compared to Olivia, Claire was an ant. Maybe less.

She gulped, thoroughly intimidated.

12321222122121111222121.content:
"You've got to be kidding, old man!" screamed Thiel as he ran up to Claire's side.

"All of that is Olivia?!" questioned Claire a look of horror crossing her facial features.

"Unfortunately yes...I told you that blasted girl became obsess with devouring those blobs of ours now she's become a blob! I don't know about you two but I plan to flee this hellhole while there's still time and claim my prize. Join me if you wish or die here as that madwoman's flesh comes crashing down upon you."

While Claire didn't like the older man's tone she had to admit he was right about the risk that now faced the remains of the city. Suddenly a forgotten thought came to her mind.

"Sherry! Oh god I forgot all about her!" Thiel stared at her wondering just who this person that Claire spoke about was but before he could question she turned to face him, almost embedding him into a fleshy prison.

"Sherry I have to find Sherry before I can truly leave Raccoon City."

"This Sherry person may already be dead, woman." stated the old man rather coldly. To which Claire shot an icy glare at.

"No I refuse to believe that. Like me she's resourceful when she has to be, I have to find her. Thiel go with him (pointing at the old man) and escort him out of the city while there's still time. I'll go look for Sherry and meet up with you later."

"But Claire!"

Claire placed a finger to his lip before kissing his cheek gently, "Don't worry about me I'll be fine. I'll find Sherry and maybe in the process stop Olivia from getting any larger."

With a heavy sigh Thiel nodded in agreement, "Be careful Claire and best of luck."

"Alright old man you're with me. Let's move!" he yelled out as he ran up to the older male's side.

Claire watched the two leave as the rumbling all around her was getting stronger.

"I"ll have to move as quick as I can as well. I have to find Sherry before something terrible happens and Olivia is getting fatter by the second...if I don't do something who knows how large she'll grow."

"Oh, no you don't!" Claire shouted, charging forth heavily, her whole body shaking wildly, and she then quickly, cleanly, and expertly chomped the blob away from Sherry...and adding another 150 pounds to her already extraordinary body.

Sherry, half-overjoyed and half-bewildered, looked up at the enormous Claire.
"Claire...what...happened to you?"

The thing that called itself Rebecca Chambers crawled toward the open factory, wanting to lay her brood before something killed her. It was simply a matter of survival. But she couldn't shake the feeling she was being watched. The sharp clang of metal on concrete echoed once or twice. Leaves rustled gently as the something whispered past. It had no scent, she could tell, and it was inhuman. Not like her, no. Something made of synthetic flesh and bone. Something artificial. Another whisper of a breeze. Rebecca turned her fattened face towards the sound, but it was gone. The clang of metal on concrete echoed again. Soft sounds of whirring gears and hydraulics caught her attention. She wish she had a weapon that was useful against something like this, but what was it called? What was the blasted thing called?

Oh right. A gun. So far had the virus warped her body and mind. She looked into a pool of water. She was something completely hideous. A gaping mouth, blazing out into the world while the rest of her facial features were indistinguishable. Tears fell down her ugly cheeks at what she had become. Maybe she should just die. She wouldn't be accepted by anyone. She couldn't go back to family if she found them. She was all alone. A big, stupid pink mass of disgusting flesh, warped by science into a creature most horrifying. The tinny of engines made her look up, but it was gone, whatever was there. Her once beautiful body was turned into something like Jabba the Hutt from Star Wars. An ugly, grotesque, slug-like being bent only on instinct, lust, and gluttony. The college girl, the happiest time of her life to go out on a mission, turned into a freak.

The sound came again, but this time from the pipe rafters and I-beam ceiling. A young girl's voice called out.

"Poor little child, thy form and thy warped mind hast made you a shell of thou former self," the voice said from up on high. Her ugly face gazed up at the ceiling.

"Wh-who are you?" The voice that came out was awful...guttural in sound. What happened to her voice? It was disturbing how much she had changed.

"Something you know of, but someONE you know not." A sharp THUMP came from a spot about thirty yards away. However, it was in total darkness and even with Rebecca's twisted form she couldn't see who it was. Or rather WHAT for that matter. She slithered over, her form making disgusting squelching sound as she did.

"Wh-who are you?" she asked once more. A reply came swiftly. It was very quiet, like a lost little girl explaining something.

"Just call me Guardian for now, little one." A form stepped out of the shadow. It was a robot, it appeared, with smooth, long legs and a short, angular torso. The blocky shoulders gave way to shapely, graceful arms. It had a young girl's head, with grey eyes and a cropped head of black hair. She cradled a giant rifle in one hand. The other had some sort of attachment on it. Something that looked like a missile pack rested behind her right shoulder, and a long, triangular cannon rested behind her left. Her eyes were sad, almost ready to cry. The rifle pulsed deadly energy.

"What are you?" Rebecca asked, frightened. Her form quivered. She raised the rifle, the tip glowing a cyan blue.

"The cure to this destabilization of man. Hold still." The rifle fired, emitting a pulse of energy so powerful it blazed over Rebecca, knocking her out. Her body sank into itself, repairing her form. Her skin above the slug half returned to normal. The tail smoothed out into a graceful shape instead of the hideous amorphous mass it was before. Her face returned to normal, but it was slightly cherubic, her cheeks a little chubbier. Her lips regained their former shape, and her breasts slowly receded into her chest, reverting back to their normal, slightly fattened, perky selves. Her waist slimmed down, but her hips flared out above the slug half, giving her a fairly decent hourglass. She was back to normal. Or, about as normal as you can get with a half-slug body. She slept peacefully for the rest of the night.

15233222121.content:
Ada Wong was following the leads left for her by a clone created by her old employer Simmons who used one of his trusted and loyal scientist's as an experimental subject that made her just like Ada in both appearance and mind set yet the true personality of Carla broke free from his control and went mad with the revelation of his betrayal and use of her along with the mental reworking which has now turned her into a woman thirsting for the destruction of the entire world.

Ada did her part in helping the BSAA and Leon from the Shadow's wherever she went before arriving at the ship where her man target Carla was commanding her infected forces from in China. After a chase and be chased by BSAA soldiers Chris and Piers Ada watched as Carla was gunned down before launching the missile carrying the virus into china.

Ada descended down to the body after the Soldiers had left and looked down upon her created carbon copy with Pity, not remorse. "If you had sought only vengeance against Simmons alone. I would've helped you.".

upon finishing those words, Carla's dead hand unclenched to reveal a syringe rolling off her hand before her eye's opened wide with an unquenchable fire of madness and hate within them before her body started to spasm with white gooey liquid erupting from her mouth and covering her face, the recently deceased woman stood up clinching her throat that continued to let out bile that covered her entire form "Get over yourself. Help?" she spat out in anger "I'm the real Ada Wong! I don't need help form anybody!"

Carla continued to rant, even as her physical body degenerated into a writhing form of white goo that continued to spread across the deck in mass before she liquidated into a the mass before her, Ada thought she was gone for just a second before Carla's voice boomed all around her "And I, Ada Wong Shall become queen of the world!" Ada ran as the mass of slime advanced towards her.

she quickly made into the ship and locked the water sealed door behind her just in time for the living mass of slime to collide against it and smear against the port hole window of the door.

As Ada stood there looking at the moving liquid form of Carla move around in front of her, unaware at the newly transformed women was already making her way through the ship intent on getting the secret agent.

once Ada had made her peace she turn around towards the hallway, intent on escaping the doom ship.

But does she?

Does Ada encounter the first of the slime clone's
